-KTBrR0NYCMgqhwn2esE.name: Nicholas
-KTBrR0NYCMgqhwn2esE.text: Decorating in the sense of adding extra functionality to a class or object

-KTBrgwEN2Dmvp6fPMPz.name: Nicholas
-KTBrgwEN2Dmvp6fPMPz.text: "Decorators are a design pattern that is used to separate modification or decoration of a class without modifying the original source code. In Angular, decorators are functions that allow a service, directive or filter to be modified prior to its usage."

-KTBrjJ_-RMCD92EWFx4.name: Justin

-KTBsjlhlZZSCDIz_iim.name: Yaik
-KTBsjlhlZZSCDIz_iim.text: Bidirectional - When properties in the model get updated, so does the UI.  Unidirectional - Binds the value of the model to the view but it doesn't determine the if the value in the view has been changed by the user.

-KTBsvLZ2T6dwF0kW8IV.name: Nicholas
-KTBsvLZ2T6dwF0kW8IV.text: (Maybe) Bidirectional - The balance of a bank account if the value gets updated in real timeUnidirectional

-KTBt7Z01AIU1GXAQXv6.name: Nicholas
-KTBt7Z01AIU1GXAQXv6.text: Unidirectional - the title of a web app (updating the view using the DOM editor should not update the title name stored in the model)

-KTBtV6lwwS16ZP50XW7.name: Manan
-KTBtV6lwwS16ZP50XW7.text: undirectional: function updateMyNameValue(elem) {    // find scope variable of `myName` and update it    // find element in view and update it } <input type="text" onchange="updateMyNameValue(this)" value="" />

-KTC15T3yD41HPj1SKyi.name: Jimmy

-KTC2YM2hb-kLFkUaTOk.name: Nicola
-KTC2YM2hb-kLFkUaTOk.text: I think A is asking why are the use of the mixed quotes needed

-KTC2_y7NtOR1AssW1jU.name: Manan
-KTC2_y7NtOR1AssW1jU.text: a. The mixture of quotes are used to do string matching. The single quote is used so the condition from string matching can be placed inside.  b. They would all work as long the string that you are trying to match is placed in the quotes (either single or double) for the string matching

-KTC2lwde7rjaFT4HGrN.name: Abhijith
